lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Greet.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Greet.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Main class for the Ragebait application.
* Initializes storage, UI, and task list, and runs the main program loop.
* Constructs a Ragebait application with a specified file path for storage.
* @param filePath Path to the file where tasks are saved and loaded.
ui.showMessage("Error loading tasks. Starting with an empty list.");
* Starts the main program loop to read and execute user commands until exit.
Command c = Parser.parse(fullCommand);  // Returns a Command object
isExit = c.isExit();  // ExitCommand will set this to true
* Command to add a new task (ToDo, Deadline, or Event) to the TaskList.
* Parses the user input and creates the appropriate Task object.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task type and arguments.
* @param type Type of the task ("todo", "deadline", or "event").
* @param args Arguments for the task (description and optional date/time).
* Parses the input arguments and adds the corresponding Task to the TaskList.
* Displays messages via UI about the added task or any errors in input.
* @param tasks TaskList to add the new task to.
* @param ui UI to display messages to the user.
* @param storage Storage for saving tasks (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) {
t = new ToDo(args);  // ToDos do not need dates
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
ui.showMessage("Invalid input or date format! Use dd/MM/yyyy HHmm.");
* Abstract class representing a user command in the Ragebait application.
* All commands should extend this class and implement the execute method.
* Executes the command on the given tasks using UI and storage.
* @param storage Storage for persisting task data.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage);
* Indicates whether this command causes the application to exit.
* @return true if the command exits the program; false otherwise.
* Command to delete a task from the TaskList.
* Removes the task at the specified index and displays messages via UI.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand for the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to delete (0-based).
* Returns the index of the task to delete.
* Deletes the task at the given index from the TaskList.
* Displays messages about the removed task and the updated task count.
* @param ui UI for displaying messages to the user.
* @param storage Storage for saving tasks (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("I CAN'T DELETE! THIS DOES NOT EXIST!");
ui.showMessage("Are you done? or just lazy? Removed:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
* Command to exit the Ragebait application.
* Saves the current task list to storage and signals the program to terminate.
* Executes the exit command by saving all tasks to storage and displaying a farewell message.
* @param ui UI for displaying messages to the user.
* @param storage Storage used to persist the tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Finally! I was getting tired of you!");
* Indicates that this command will terminate the application.
* @return true always, since executing this command exits the program.
* Finds and lists all tasks whose description contains the given keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword Keyword to search in task descriptions.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("No matching tasks found for keyword: " + keyword);
ui.showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Command to list all tasks currently stored in the TaskList.
* Displays all tasks in the TaskList using the UI.
* @param ui UI used to display the list.
* @param storage Storage (not used for this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* Command to mark a task as completed in the TaskList.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("NICE LA! You managed to accomplish something in your life for once.");
* Returns the index of the task to mark.

* Returns the index of the task to unmark.

* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the command is unknown or required arguments are missing.
if (args.isEmpty()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Specify a ragebait.task number!");

throw new IllegalArgumentException("Please provide a keyword to search!");

* Provides methods to add, remove, retrieve, and list tasks.

if (tasks.isEmpty()) return "No tasks in the list!";

* Represents the type of a task in the Ragebait application.
* Each task type has a symbol used for display and file storage.
* Constructs a TaskType with the given symbol.
* @param symbol Symbol for the task type.
* Returns the symbol representing the task type.
* Represents a To-Do task in the Ragebait application.
* A To-Do task only has a description and a completion status,
* and does not require any date or time.
